Farm manager

• Creating a platform for you to own a farm

Farm manager is a an app that is supposed to serve as a platform or channel of communication between the administrator and the farm finder(Client). The clients will use the app to state their needs as the app will provide several links for services it provides as the prices of services are attached to the required services. The bottom line is that when a client chooses a service, he is required to either make a part or complete payment to acquire the identification card which will be definitely received in person at the at the administrative office which serves as proof for the clients. The I.D card is like a pass in case the farmer wants have a routine check on his crops . As soon as identification and payment is made, it remains the job of the administration to get the required farm size, and employ labourers to do their customers biddings with a routine check for pests and possible threats, application of fertilizer and weed control until its time for harvest.

INSPIRATION: I took interest from the consistent procrastination by so many interested persons on agriculture who remain unable to achieve their goals because of some reasons like lack of farmland, time, idea about the appropriate crop to plant at a particular season or period.

Built With

  • node.js
  • javascript
  • php5
Farmer's Market

Inspiration

The need to reduce losses experienced by farmers as a result of difficulty in accessing markets and storage inspires this project.

What it does

The solution connects farmers to value providers (transportation, warehousing, inspection, advisory). This makes it possible for the farmers to notify the market when they have produce for sale or storage. The market can respond to the farmers by making purchase offers or placing bids.

How I built it

This is still at a prototype stage.

Challenges I ran into

We realized that we needed to cater to the numerous farmers that were uneducated and would have difficulty in using a robust web-based application. We implemented an IVR system to cater to this niche of farmers in six languages (English, French, Igbo, Hause, Pidgin, Yoruba)

Accomplishments that I'm proud of

We are proud of the solution we came up with that provides various options: Voice, SMS, and Website in six languages. This will ensure that participants in both rural and urban areas will be able to use the solution.

What I learned

We learned about various needs that farmers have. Things we did not know about farmers' needs came to the surface when we started working on this project.

What's next for Farmer's Market

It will be built into a complete product and developed into a startup.

  • css3
  • javascript

Agriin

Agriin

is an online environment that will collaboratively bring (Governments, Technocrats, Extension workers, farmers, and content seekers) to share and benefit from information in the form of (podcast, text, pictures, video, and webcast) in an interactive and engaging platform.

Industry Overview

Governments around the globe over the years had brought numerous initiatives that more or less impacted the agricultural value chain. Yearning challenges and epidermics has also it's shares in creating downtimes in the sector.

Information and Communications Technology can and will play a key role in changing and impacting agricultural information chain in a dessiminating approach.

AGRIIN will be an interactive and collaboratively built electronic platform where information will be shared through a range of channels in different formats. This will indeed bridge huge gap that exited and accelerated over the years.

It will mostly contain identified group of individuals and contents sharing similar interests, concerns, and educational needs around this subject area (agriculture). A virtual network that is multi-institutional, multi-disciplinary, open, fluid and flexible that will evolve over time as well being responsive to communities of interest.

AGRIIN will seek to convene a collaboration with existing local and international organizations and partnership most concerned with knowledge management and extension to assess feasibility through a business case for an evolving global platform.

Farmers Pride Network

• This image is currently processing. Please be patient...

Inspiration

Clustered and isolated farmers are found around Africa with no access to market, their produce is consumed by them and their nearest neighbor whereas a lot of people need their product but resort to importation while our local produce endup in waste bins. Nigeria’s demand for tomato is about 2.2mt/annum we are producing about 1.5 million tons but 0.7mt is lost post-harvest delivering 0.8mt to the market while about .7mt is being imported in both fresh and processed form into the country. Coffee producers in Nigeria have no access to market as well, most of what they produce rots while some are being consumed by the people around them but there is market availability for imported coffee Fruits as well get rotten in tons annually as there is no enough market access for them and no access to both local and foreign processors. These problems also affects most other locally produced foods, some either have no access to market or processors leaving the farmers poor and hopeless.

What it does

Farmers Pride Network (http://farmerspride.com.ng) connects farmers, buyers and processors together as well as consumers and retailers in the open market. Most farmers are not literate about use of internet therefore, we are designing our platform to forward online inquiry to farmers via SMS on their mobile phones so they can call the potential customer to have verbal conversation. At the same time, it is our duty to collect information from farmers who cannot post their product on the platform by themselves integrate it for them and also create awareness so that buyers, farmers and processors can get linked up

How I built it

We are using a Drupal Content Management System (CMS) with other programming languages such as php,css, mysql and others for the development. The platform is still till under development.

Challenges I ran into

Accomplishments that I'm proud of

What I learned

What's next for Farmers Pride Newtwork

AgroHealth Care Connects (AHCC)

Inspiration...

AGROHEALTH CARE CONNECTS (AHCC) MISSION: Brading the gap between farmers, veterinary doctors and government in such a way that the farmers can have access to the veterinary doctors when there is an outbreak of disease/emergencies. "Connecting Veterinary Doctors to their customers (farmers)" As well as bringing the farmers, veterinary doctors closer to the government. Essentially, providing the government with a database of farmers wherein the farmers can get benefits that beckons from the government. The crop and animal detection will be carried out via a detailed and comprehensive database platforms, that will enable the Veterinary doctors to access the info provided. It will also be an easy platform for farmers to use in terms of uploading their basic info and profiles. The farmers will be required to send in signs and symptoms that they noticed. These, in turn, will be uploaded.
yelah

Inspiration

As a farmer and a techpreneur, i needed an application i can use to communicate with others farmers without the internet.

What it does

Yelah enables farmers to chat, call,send images and files to each other within the range of 3km to 5km without having internet access.

How I built it

Yelah was built using javascript and it uses wifi connection,and with intense interaction with other farmers and agricultural stakeholders.

Challenges I ran into

most farmers have not adapted to technology

Accomplishments that I'm proud of

Yelah version 1.0 is ready

What I learned

farmers want to connect, they are always looking for ways to interact directly with others farmers, customers and experts that can help solve their problems.

What's next for Yelah

we plan to lunch Yelah with a short number of farmers to start with, then we wish to extent it further more to other parts of the country, within a year or more, we plan to scale yelah to other part of the world.

AUTOMATED FARM MONITORING SYSTEM

Inspiration

The importance of agriculture in the world cannot be over emphasized. Just like every other field agriculture comes with its own problems. Here we have come up with a solution to tackle the most frequent problems associated to agriculture via the use of technology and as such improving it yeilds

What it does

This device or robot will be fully automated and programmed to carry out monitoring activities within the farm land. With the aid of specialized sensors it can check the moisture of the soil, its fertility and it can also alert the farmer when fertilizer should be reapplied to increase the fertility of the soil via text messages and emails. Triggers a system to sprinkle water when the soil is not moist enough.

How I built it

After carrying rigorous research, the development process involves circuits design, C programming language, sensors, programmed micro chips e.t.c

Challenges we ran into

One of the major challenges is shortage of resources especially the monitory aspect of it.

Our Accomplishments

We have be able to come up with a pretty good plan that is cost effective, efficient and feasible.

What we have learned

Coming together and working as a team exposes you to so many ideas and how to tackle a problem from different angles.

What's next for AUTOMATED FARM MONITORING SYSTEM

Funding to embark on this journey

Built With

  • c
GONAMAPS

• HERDSMEN

  • FARMERS

Inspiration

This application is inspired by the recent Fulani herdsmen crisis in Nigeria.

What it does

The application aids the farmer to plot his farmland location on the map, and the Fulani herdsmen view this locations and get guided on the routes and paths to avoid when they move around with there cattle. All the app does is get the longitude and latitude of a farmers present location and plots it on the map.

How we built it

This application is an android based application which works on GPS enabled devices.

Challenges we ran into

The major challenge is 75-80% of farmers and herdsmen have no knowledge of smartphones or don not even use one. This major limitation can be tackled where a farmer prints out the map after plotting and creating a signpost 300-500 meters from his farm.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

This application cache data in a situation where there is no network and posts immediately network is available. And is an application that translates to hausa for ease of use for both farmers and herdsmen.

What we learned

The GONAMAPS will only reduce but not completely eliminate the crisis between farmers and herdsmen, so there are upgrades which will most likely hold to revamp the application.

What's next for GONAMAPS

Implementation and Upgrades to increase its efficiency

Built With

  • android

Try it out

AgroSmartGuide

• Main Dashboard

  • Login Panel

  • Main Panel

  • Data Input (i.e where to input climatic data)

Inspiration

The use of IT has grown to such an unprecedented stage that it is now possible to do much more than was possible heretofore. It is considered equally important to seek adequate weather condition for planting as it is to utilize the right seedlings. This work is inspired by the vast possibilities that can be achieved with IT and aims at developing a system which monitors, and guides a farmer before, during and after planting.

What it does

It monitors the weather condition automatically and sends proactive instructions to the farmer in regards to the specific plants on the farm i.e. a given location. Some of the weather conditions being monitored include temperature, humidity, wind direction and speed. Soil PH and water content level are also monitored to ensure an enabling environment for plants production. In the case of animal production, PH level of the aquaculture is monitored for fish production.

How we built it

This application is a java desktop application with a robust database containing data-set of climate weather condition for crops and animals. The integration of the desktop application and the hardware part is also carried out. Hardware section consists of a micro-controller and sensors. Assembly language is also used for the micro-controller programming.

Challenges in development

The main challenge that will be encountered in developing the system is that of the finance for the procurement of the relevant sensors.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

As a team we are able to come up with a partially working system which when given time to revamp the software will be full working application and ready for implementation

What we learned

We are able to learn the advantage of teamwork and the synergy it aids us to come up with this wonderful idea

What's next for AgroSmartGuide

To be fully designed and implemented........

Built With

  • java
  • mysql
  • microcontroller
  • sensors

AgriHub

Inspiration

The Agric sector in Nigeria lacks the capacity to attract local and foreign investment due to the fact that the investors lack access to consulting services that will enable them asses the viability of the venture.

What it does

The AgriHub Webapp provides a handshake between Investors, Famers and Agric Service Providers on investment requirement, feasibility, viability, productivity and profitability in the chosen area of investment in Agriculture. AgriHub exposes investors to the vast business opportunities in the Agric sector.

How I built it

We built the Webapp using open source technologies with a flexible entry and exit for users depending on their specific requirement. We used a three tier architecture and an agile development approach.

Challenges I ran into

Organising team members to meet up with time lines Breaking down the complexity of the application into manageable modules Sourcing for agricultural information to reflect dynamics of different value chain.

Accomplishments that I'm proud of

What I learned

Team work Collaboration to achieve goals Sharing Ideas

What's next for AgriHub
